revision.comment: Better sourcing the frequent use of electropop in Britney's discography. Removing Facebook link, since her official website links to it very visibly. [[WP:NOT]] a collection of links.
revision.text:
{{Redirect|Britney|Britney Spears's third album|Britney (album)|other uses|Britney (disambiguation)}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}}{{pp-move-indef}} {{Infobox musical artist | image = Britney Europe.jpg | caption = Spears performing on her [[Femme Fatale Tour]] in 2011. | years_active = 1992–present | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Britney Jean Spears | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|12|2|mf=y}} | birth_place = {{nowrap|[[Kentwood, Louisiana]], U.S.}} | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[dance-pop]], [[Synthpop|electropop]] | occupation = Singer, songwriter, dancer, actress, record producer, author, fashion designer, video director, entertainer | instrument = Vocals, piano | label = [[Jive Records|Jive]], [[RCA Records|RCA]]{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/record-labels/rca-s-peter-edge-tom-corson-on-the-shuttering-1005394732.story |title=RCA's Peter Edge, Tom Corson on the Shuttering of Jive, J and Arista |publisher=Billboard.biz |date=2011-10-07 |accessdate=2011-11-05}} | associated_acts = [[The Mickey Mouse Club#1990s revival, The All-New Mickey Mouse Club (MMC)|The New Mickey Mouse Club]], [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[will.i.am]], [[Dr. Luke]], | website = {{URL|britneyspears.com}}
{{URL|britney.com}} }} '''Britney Jean Spears''' (born December 2, 1981) is an American [[recording artist]] and [[entertainer]]. Born in [[McComb, Mississippi]], and raised in [[Kentwood, Louisiana]], she began performing as a child, landing acting roles in stage productions and television shows. She signed with [[Jive Records]] in 1997 and released her debut album ''[[...Baby One More Time]]'' in 1999, which became the best-selling album by a teenage solo artist.Folkard, Claire (2003). ''Guinness World Records 2003''. Bantam Books. p. 288. ISBN 978-0-553-58636-7. During her first decade in the music industry, she became a prominent figure in mainstream popular music and popular culture, followed by a much-publicized personal life. Her first two albums established her as a [[pop icon]] and broke sales records, while title tracks "[[...Baby One More Time (song)|...Baby One More Time]]" and "[[Oops!... I Did It Again (song)|Oops!... I Did It Again]]" became international number-one hits. Spears was credited with influencing the revival of [[teen pop]] during the late 1990s, and became the 'best-selling teenaged artist of all time' before she turned 20,Ruggieri, Melissa (2000-12-19). "Music Notes". ''Richmond Times-Dispatch'': pp. D.13 garnering her honorific titles such as "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Princess of Pop]]".Often referred to in interviews, cover stories and promotional material as the new 'princess of pop' Susan Hopkins (2002), ''Girl Heroes: The New Force In Popular Culture'', University of Michigan Press, p. 60 In 2001, she released her third studio album ''[[Britney (album)|Britney]]'' and expanded her brand, playing the starring role in the film ''[[Crossroads (2002 film)|Crossroads]]''. She assumed creative control of her fourth studio album, ''[[In the Zone]]'' (2003), which yielded chart-topping singles "[[Me Against the Music]]", "[[Toxic (song)|Toxic]]" and "[[Everytime]]". After the release of two compilation albums, Spears experienced personal struggles and her career went into hiatus. Her fifth studio album, ''[[Blackout (Britney Spears album)|Blackout]]'', was released in 2007 and despite receiving little promotion, it spawned hits "[[Gimme More]]" and "[[Piece of Me]]". In 2008, her erratic behavior and hospitalizations caused her to be placed in a [[conservatorship]]. The same year, her sixth studio album ''[[Circus (Britney Spears album)|Circus]]'' was released, with the global chart-topping lead single "[[Womanizer (song)|Womanizer]]", and hits such as "[[Circus (song)|Circus]]" and "[[If U Seek Amy]]". She embarked on her highest-grossing global concert tour,{{cite web|url=http://www.hollyscoop.com/music/madonna/15-most-profitable-female-tours-ever_2133.aspx|title=15 Most Profitable Female Tours Ever|date=2010-05-21|accessdate=2010-07-27| last=Esmailian|first=Ani|work=Hollyscoop|publisher=DNA Group}} [[The Circus Starring Britney Spears]], in 2009. In October of the same year, she released a chart-topping single, "[[3 (song)|3]]", which became her third single to reach number one on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. Her seventh studio album ''[[Femme Fatale (Britney Spears album)|Femme Fatale]]'', released in 2011, has become the first of her albums to yield three top ten singles in the United States, "[[Hold It Against Me]]", "[[Till the World Ends]]" and "[[I Wanna Go]]". The same year, she also gained her fifth number one single when she featured on the remix of "[[S&M (song)|S&M]]" alongside [[Rihanna]]. Spears's work has earned her [[List of awards and nominations received by Britney Spears|numerous awards]] and accolades, including a [[Grammy Awards|Grammy Award]], 6 [[MTV Video Music Awards]] including the [[MTV Video Vanguard Award|Lifetime Achievement Award]], 9 [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], and a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]]. In 2009, ''Billboard'' ranked her as the 8th overall Artist of the Decade, and also recognized her as the best-selling female artist of the first decade of the 21st century, as well as the fifth overall. The [[RIAA certification|Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) also recognized Spears as the seventh [[List of best-selling music artists in the United States|top-selling female artist]] in the United States, with 34 million [[RIAA certification|certified]] albums.{{cite web|url=http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?table=tblTopArt|title=RIAA — Gold & Platinum — May 3, 2010|year=2010|accessdate=2010-05-03|work=[[Recording Industry Association of America]]|publisher=[[Mitch Bainwol]]}} [[Nielsen SoundScan]] ranked Spears the tenth best-selling digital artist of the country, with more than 28.6 million digital singles as of January 2012.{{cite press release|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20120105005547/en/Nielsen-Company-Billboard%E2%80%99s-2011-Music-Industry-Report|title=The Nielsen Company & Billboard's 2011 Music Industry Report|publisher=[[Business Wire]]|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/64TshZep3|archivedate=2012-01-06}} She has sold over 100 million albums worldwide, making her one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists]] of all time.{{cite news|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/britney-spears-pictured-backstage-at-rock-89309|title=Britney Spears pictured backstage at Rock Of Ages with Shane Ward|last=Moodie|first=Clemmie|work=Daily Mirror |location=UK|publisher=Trinity Mirror|date=2011-11-03|accessdate=2012-02-23}} ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' recognized her instant success as one of the Top 25 Teen Idol Breakout Moments of all time,{{cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/the-top-25-teen-idol-breakout-moments-20120511/britney-spears-2000-19691231|title=The Top 25 Teen Idol Breakout Moments – Britney Spears|accessdate=2012-05-15|work=Rolling Stone}} while [[VH1]] ranked her eleventh on their "100 Greatest Women in Music" list in 2012,{{cite web|last=Graham|first=Mark|url=http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2012-02-13/vh1s-100-greatest-women-in-music-complete-list/|title=VH1's 100 Greatest Women In Music (Complete List)|publisher=VH1|date=2012-02-13|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/65vGgxvII|archivedate=2012-03-05}} and ''Billboard'' named her the sexiest woman in music.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/features/music-s-sexiest-man-woman-poll-results-1007209952.story?utm_source=most_recent|title=Music's Sexiest Man & Woman: Poll Results|date=2012-06-12|accessdate=2012-06-12|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|work=Billboard|author=Billboard Staff}} ''[[Forbes]]'' also revealed that Spears was the sixth most powerful celebrity, and the third best paid musician of 2011–12, having topped the list back in 2002.{{cite web|url=http://www.forbes.com/celebrities/#p_1_s_d2_Musicians_|title=The World's Most Powerful Celebrities|work=Forbes|date=2012-05-16|accessdate=2012-05-17}} ==Life and career== ===1981–97: Early life and career beginnings=== Britney Jean Spears was born on December 2, 1981, the second child of [[Lynne Spears|Lynne Irene]] (née Bridges) and James Parnell Spears. Her maternal grandmother, Lillian Portell, was [[English American|English]] (born in London), and one of Spears's maternal great-great-grandfathers was [[Maltese people|Maltese]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1056674/EXCLUSIVE-First-photos-Britney-Spears-newly-discovered-British-family.html|title=Exclusive: First photos of Britney Spears' newly-discovered British family|work=Daily Mail |location=UK |date=2008-09-17|accessdate=2010-06-04|last=Thomas|first=Liz}}{{harvnb|Spears|Craker|2008|p=4}} Her siblings are Bryan James and [[Jamie Lynn Spears|Jamie Lynn]].{{harvnb|Spears|Craker|2008|p=211}} At age three, she started attending dance lessons in her hometown of [[Kentwood, Louisiana]], and was selected to perform as a solo artist at the annual recital. During her childhood, she also attended gymnastics and voice lessons, and won many state-level competitions and children's talent shows.{{harvnb|Spears|Craker|2008|p=56}}{{cite journal|url=|title=Cover Story: Britney Spears: Britney Spears : Rolling Stone|date=1999-04-15|work=Rolling Stone|publisher=[[Jann Wenner]]|last=Daly|first=Steven|issn=0035-791X|ref=harv}}{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,195283,00.html|title=Britney Spears' Biography |publisher=Fox News |date=2008-07-31|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Reporter|first=Staff}} Spears made her local stage debut at age five, singing "[[What Child Is This?]]" at her [[kindergarten]] graduation. She said about her ambition as a child, "I was in my own world, [...] I found out what I'm supposed to do at an early age". At age eight, Spears and her mother Lynne traveled to [[Atlanta]] for an audition in the 1990s revival of ''[[The Mickey Mouse Club]]''. Casting director Matt Casella rejected her for being too young to join the series at the time, but introduced her to Nancy Carson, a New York City talent agent. Carson was impressed with Spears's vocals and suggested enrolling her at the [[Professional Performing Arts School]]; shortly after, Lynne and her daughters moved to a sublet apartment in New York. Spears was hired for her first professional role as the understudy for the lead role of Tina Denmark in the Off-Broadway musical ''[[Ruthless!]]''. She also appeared as a contestant on the popular television show ''[[Star Search]]'', as well as being cast in a number of commercials.{{harvnb|Spears|Craker|2008|p=75}}{{harvnb|Laufenberg|2005|p=616}} In December 1992, she was finally cast in ''The Mickey Mouse Club'', but returned to Kentwood after the show was canceled. She enrolled at [[Parklane Academy]] in nearby [[McComb, Mississippi]]. Although she made friends with most of her classmates, she compared the school to "the opening scene in ''[[Clueless (film)|Clueless]]'' with all the [[cliques]]. [...] I was so bored. I was the point guard on the basketball team. I had my boyfriend, and I went to homecoming and Christmas formal. But I wanted more."{{cite journal|url=|title=Cover Story: The Girl Can't Help It|date=2000-05-25|work=Rolling Stone|last=Mundy|first=Chris|issn=0035-791X|ref=harv}} In June 1997, Spears was in talks with manager [[Lou Pearlman]] to join the female pop group [[Innosense]]. Lynne asked family friend and entertainment lawyer [[Larry Rudolph]] for his opinion and submitted a tape of Spears singing over a [[Whitney Houston]] karaoke song along with some pictures. Rudolph decided he wanted to pitch her to record labels, therefore she needed a professional demo. He sent Spears an unused song of [[Toni Braxton]]; she rehearsed for a week and recorded her vocals in a studio with a [[Audio engineering|sound engineer]]. Spears traveled to New York with the demo and met with executives from four labels, returning to Kentwood the same day. Three of the labels rejected her, arguing that audiences wanted pop bands such as the [[Backstreet Boys]] and the [[Spice Girls]], and "there wasn't going to be another [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], another [[Debbie Gibson]], or another [[Tiffany (singer)|Tiffany]]." Two weeks later, executives from [[Jive Records]] returned calls to Rudolph.{{harvnb|Hughes|2005|p=145}} Senior vice president of [[A&R]] Jeff Fenster stated about Spears's audition that "It's very rare to hear someone that age who can deliver emotional content and commercial appeal. [...] For any artist, the motivation—the 'eye of the tiger'—is extremely important. And Britney had that." She then sang Houston's "[[I Have Nothing]]" (1992) for the executives, and got signed to the label.{{cite journal | author=Taylor, Chuck | url = http://books.google.com/?id=JQoEAAAAMBAJ&lpg=PA1&pg=PA80#v=onepage&q&f=false | journal=Billboard | title = Air Waves: Jive's Britney Spears Sets Top 40 Abuzz With Rhythm-Leaning 'Baby One More Time' | publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc. | volume = 110 | issue = 43 | date = 1998-10-24 | accessdate = 2011-03-11 | issn = 0006-2510 | ref=harv}} They appointed her to work with producer Eric Foster White for a month, who reportedly shaped her voice from "lower and less poppy" delivery to "distinctively, unmistakably Britney."{{harvnb|Hughes|2005|p=147}} After hearing the recorded material, president [[Clive Calder]] ordered a full album. Spears had originally envisioned "[[Sheryl Crow]] music, but younger more adult contemporary" but felt all right with her label's appointment of producers, since "It made more sense to go pop, because I can dance to it—it's more me." She flew to [[Cheiron Studios]] in Stockholm, Sweden, where half of the album was recorded from March to April 1998, with producers [[Max Martin]], [[Denniz Pop]] and [[Rami Yacoub]], among others. ===1998–00: ''...Baby One More Time'' and ''Oops!... I Did It Again''=== After Spears returned to the United States, she embarked on a shopping mall promotional tour to promote her forthcoming album. Her show was a four song set and she was accompanied by two back up dancers. Her first concert tour followed, as an opening act for [['N Sync]].{{harvnb|Blandford|2002|p=28}} Her debut album, ''[[...Baby One More Time]]'', was released on January 1999.{{cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/britney-spears-teen-queen-rolling-stones-1999-cover-story-20110329|title=Britney Spears, Teen Queen: Rolling Stone's 1999 Cover Story|work=Rolling Stone|year=2011|accessdate=2010-01-22}} It debuted at number one on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and was certified two-times [[Music recording sales certification|platinum]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] after a month. Worldwide, the album topped the charts in fifteen countries and sold over ten million copies in a year.{{harvnb|Blandford|2002|p=30}} It became the biggest selling album ever by a teenage artist. The [[...Baby One More Time (song)|title track]] was released as the [[lead single]] from the album. Originally, Jive Records wanted its music video to be animated; however, Spears rejected it, and suggested the final idea of a Catholic schoolgirl. The single sold 500,000 copies on its first day, and peaked at number one on the [[Billboard Hot 100]], topping the chart for two consecutive weeks.{{harvnb|Blandford|2002|p=29}}{{harvnb|Bronson|2003|p=377}} "...Baby One More Time" later received a [[Grammy]] nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance|Best Female Pop Vocal Performance]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rockonthenet.com/archive/2000/grammys.htm|title=Rock On The Net: 42nd Annual Grammy Awards – 2000|work=[[National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences]]|publisher=RockOntheNet.com|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-05}} The title track also topped the singles chart for two weeks in the United Kingdom, and became the fastest-selling single ever by a female artist, shipping over 460,000 copies.{{cite web|url=http://everyhit.com/record4.html|title=Record-Breakers and Trivia |publisher=Everyhit.com|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-05}} It would later become the [[UK Million-Selling Singles|25th most successful song of all time in British chart history]].{{cite web|url=http://everyhit.com/bestsellingsingles.html|title=Best Selling Singles Of All Time|publisher=Everyhit.com|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-05}} Spears is also the youngest female artist to have a million seller in the country.{{cite web|url=http://www.theofficialcharts.com/artist/_/BRITNEY%20SPEARS/|title=Britney Spears | publisher=The Official Charts Company|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-05}} "[[(You Drive Me) Crazy]]" was released as the third single from the album. It became a top-ten hit worldwide and propelled ''...Baby One More Time'' to sell 26 million copies.{{cite news| url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2008/nov/28/britney-spears-circus |location=London |work=The Guardian | title=Britney Spears: Circus | date=2008-11-27 | first=Alexis | last=Petridis}} The April 1999 cover of ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' featured Spears lying on her bed, clad with a bra, shorts and an open top. The [[American Family Association]] (AFA) referred to the shoot as "a disturbing mix of childhood innocence and adult sexuality" and called to "God-loving Americans to boycott stores selling Britney's albums." Spears responded to the outcry commenting, "What's the big deal? I have strong morals. [...] I'd do it again. I thought the pictures were fine. And I was tired of being compared to Debbie Gibson and all of this [[bubblegum pop]] all the time."{{harvnb|Blandford|2002|p=36}} Shortly before, Spears had announced publicly she would remain a [[virgin]] until marriage. On June 28, 1999, Spears began her first headlining [[...Baby One More Time Tour]] in North America, which was positively received by critics,{{cite web|url=http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Artists/S/Spears_Britney/1999/07/10/749831.html|title=Spears takes aim at fame|date=1999-07-10|accessdate=2010-01-01|last=Stevenson|first=Jane|work=[[Jam!]]|publisher=[[Quebecor Inc.]]}} but generated some controversy due to her racy outfits.{{harvnb|Blandford|2002|p=38}} An extension of the tour, titled Crazy 2k, followed in March 2000. Spears premiered songs from her upcoming second album during the show. ''[[Oops!... I Did It Again]]'', her second studio album, was released in May 2000. It debuted at number one in the US, selling 1.3 million copies, breaking the [[SoundScan]] record for the highest debut sales by any solo artist.{{cite journal|url=|title=Oops!...She Sold 1.3 Million Albums: Britney Spears |date=2000-05-25|work=Rolling Stone|publisher=Jann Wenner|last=Skanse|first=Richard|issn=0035-791X|ref=harv}} The album sold over 20 million copies worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.britneyspears.com/2010/05/oops-week-10-fun-facts.php|title=Oops! Week: 10 Fun Facts|date=2010-05-20|accessdate=2010-06-05|last=Staff|first=Michael|publisher=BritneySpears.com Brandcasting Unlimited|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20100606172346/http://www.britneyspears.com/2010/05/oops-week-10-fun-facts.php|archivedate=2010-06-06}} [[Rob Sheffield]] of ''Rolling Stone'' said that "the great thing about ''Oops!'' – under the cheese surface, Britney's demand for satisfaction is complex, fierce and downright scary, making her a true child of [[rock & roll]] tradition."{{cite journal|url=|title=Britney Spears: Oops!...I Did It Again : Music Reviews : Rolling Stone|date=2000-06-08|work=Rolling Stone|publisher=Jann Wenner|last=Sheffield|first=Rob|issn=0035-791X|ref=harv}} The album's lead single, "[[Oops!... I Did It Again (song)|Oops!... I Did It Again]]", peaked at the top of the charts in Australia, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and many other European nations.{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=Oops!...+I+Did+It+Again&cat=s|title=ultratop.be — Britney Spears — Oops!... I Did It Again:|work=[[Ultratop]]|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=2010-06-05}} The album as well as the title track received Grammy nominations for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album|Best Pop Vocal Album]] and Best Female Pop Vocal Performance, respectively.{{cite web|url=http://www.rockonthenet.com/archive/2001/grammys.htm|title=Rock On The Net: 43nd Annual Grammy Awards – 2001|work=National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences|publisher=RockOntheNet.com|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-06}} The same year, Spears embarked on the [[Oops!... I Did It Again World Tour]], which grossed $40.5 million; she also released her first book, ''[[Britney Spears products|Britney Spears' Heart-to-Heart]]'', co-written with her mother.{{cite news|url=http://www.forbes.com/finance/lists/53/2001/LIR.jhtml?passListId=53&passYear=2001&passListType=Person&uniqueId=PREW&datatype=Person|title=Britney Spears on 100 Top Celebrities|year=2000|accessdate=2010-01-21|work=Forbes}}{{dead link|date=September 2012}} On September 7, 2000, Spears performed at the [[2000 MTV Video Music Awards]]. Halfway through the performance, she ripped off her black suit to reveal a sequined flesh-colored bodysuit, followed by heavy dance routine. It is noted by critics as the moment that Spears showed signs of becoming a more provocative performer.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1568995/20070906/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Spears' Greatest VMA Hits: Barely There Costumes, Giant Snakes And A Scandalous Lip-Lock|date=2007-09-06|accessdate=2010-06-05|last=Montgomery|first=James|publisher=MTV}} Amidst media speculation, Spears confirmed she was dating 'N Sync member [[Justin Timberlake]]. ===2001–03: ''Britney'', ''Crossroads'', and ''In the Zone''=== [[File:Britney Spears.jpg|thumb|upright|right|Spears performing at the NFL Kickoff Live in 2003.]] In February 2001, Spears signed a $7–8 million promotional deal with [[Pepsi]], and released another book co-written with her mother, entitled ''A Mother’s Gift''. Her third studio album, ''[[Britney (album)|Britney]]'', was released in November 2001. While on tour, she felt inspired by hip hop artists such as [[Jay-Z]] and [[The Neptunes]] and wanted to create a record with a funkier sound.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1450334/20011024/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Says Britney Reflects Who Britney Is|date=2001-10-25|accessdate=2010-06-05|last=Moss|first=Corey|publisher=MTV}} The album debuted at number one in the ''Billboard'' 200 and reached top five positions in Australia, the United Kingdom and mainland Europe and sold over 12 million copies worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.store.livenation.com/Product.aspx?cp=13281_16771_16305_16306&pc=MUDD413 |title= ''Britney'' sold over 12 million copies worldwide|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-12|publisher=[[Live Nation]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=Britney&cat=a|title=ultratop.be — Britney Spears — Britney|work=Ultratop|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=2010-06-05}} [[Stephen Thomas Erlewine]] of [[Allmusic]] called ''Britney'' "the record where she strives to deepen her persona, making it more adult while still recognizably Britney. [...] It does sound like the work of a star who has now found and refined her voice, resulting in her best record yet."{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r556064|pure_url=yes}}|title=Britney > Overview |year=2001|accessdate=2010-06-05|last=Erlewine|first=Stephen Thomas|publisher=[[Rovi Corporation]]}} The album was honored with two Grammy nominations—Best Pop Vocal Album and Best Female Pop Vocal Performance for "[[Overprotected]]"— and was listed in 2008 as one of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'''s "100 Best Albums from the Past 25 Years".{{cite web|url=http://www.rockonthenet.com/archive/2003/grammys.htm|title=Rock On The Net: 45nd Annual Grammy Awards – 2001|work=National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences|publisher=RockOntheNet.com|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-06}}{{cite news|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20207076_20207387_20207337,00.html|title=The New Classics: Music|work=Entertainment Weekly |year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-06}} The album's first single, "[[I'm a Slave 4 U]]", became a top-ten hit worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=I%27m+A+Slave+4+U&cat=s|title=ultratop.be — Britney Spears — I'm a Slave 4 U|work=Ultratop|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=2010-06-06}} Spears's performance of the single at the [[2001 MTV Video Music Awards]] featured a caged tiger and a large [[Burmese python|albino python]] draped over her shoulders. It was harshly received by animal rights organization [[PETA]], who claimed the animals were mistreated and scrapped plans for an anti-fur billboard that was to feature Spears. To support the album, Spears embarked on the [[Dream Within a Dream Tour]]. The show was critically praised for its technical innovations, the ''[[pièce de résistance]]'' being a water screen that pumped two tons of water into the stage.{{cite web|url=http://livedesignonline.com/mag/britneys_big_splash/index.html?smte=wr|title=Britney's Big Splash|date=2002-07-01|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=McHugh|first=Catherine|work=Live Design|publisher=[[Penton Media]]}}{{cite web|url=http://livedesignonline.com/mag/lighting_singin_rain/index.html|title=Singin' in the Rain|date=2002-08-01|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Singlerland|first=Amy L.|work=Live Design|publisher=Penton Media}} The tour grossed $43.7 million, becoming the second highest grossing tour of 2002 by a female artist, behind [[Cher]]'s [[Living Proof: The Farewell Tour|Farewell Tour]].{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/mccartney-notches-year-s-highest-grossing-1782120.story#/news/mccartney-notches-year-s-highest-grossing-1782120.story|title=McCartney Notches Year's Highest-Grossing Tour|year=2002|work=Billboard|publisher=[[Nielsen Company]]|accessdate=2010-01-26}} Her career success was highlighted by ''[[Forbes]]'' in 2002, as Spears was ranked the world's most powerful celebrity.{{cite news|url=http://www.forbes.com/lists/home.jhtml?passListId=53&passYear=2002&passListType=Person|title=Forbes Celebrity 100 2002|year=2002|accessdate=2010-06-06|work=Forbes|publisher=Forbes Publishing|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20101202174403/http://www.forbes.com/lists/home.jhtml?passListId=53&passYear=2002&passListType=Person|archivedate=2010-12-02}} Spears also landed her first starring role in ''[[Crossroads (2002 film)|Crossroads]]'', released in February 2002. Although the film was largely panned, most critics actually praised Spears's acting.{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/1112549-crossroads/|title=Crossroads Movie Reviews, Pictures — Rotten Tomatoes|year=2002|accessdate=2010-06-06|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Flixster]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.viewlondon.co.uk/films/crossroads-film-review-2625.html|title=Crossroads Film Review — Crossroads Film Pictures, Crossroads Film Trailer|date=2002-04-02|accessdate=2010-06-06|work=View London|publisher=2 View Group Ltd.}}{{harvnb|Hughes|2005|p=152}} ''Crossroads'', which had a $11 million budget, went on to gross over $57 million worldwide. In June 2002, Spears opened her first restaurant, Nyla, in New York City, but terminated her relationship in November, citing mismanagement and "management's failure to keep her fully apprised".{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1458900/20021126/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Spears Bails On Her New York Restaurant, Nyla|date=2002-11-27|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Moss|first=Corey|publisher=MTV}} In July 2002, Spears announced she would take a six month break from her career; however, she went back into the studio in November to record her new album.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1458526/20021105/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Spears' Hiatus Is History|date=2002-11-05|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Moss|first=Corey|publisher=MTV}} Spears' relationship with Justin Timberlake ended after three years. In December 2002, Timberlake released the song "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]" as the second single from his [[Justified (album)|solo debut album]]. The music video featured a Spears look-alike and fueled the rumors that she had been unfaithful to him.{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/node/226195/thi|title='This one’s for you': Ex-music couples sing of their love woes|date=2009-10-04|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Sanchez|first=Rowena Joy A.|work=[[Manila Bulletin]]|publisher=Manila Bulletin Publishing Corp.}}{{cite web|url=http://sixtyminutes.ninemsn.com.au/stories/contributors/259121/britney-revealed|title=Britney revealed|date=2003-11-23|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Sawyer|first=Diane|work=[[ninemsn]]|publisher=[[PBL Media]] / [[Microsoft]]}} As a response, Spears wrote the ballad "[[Everytime]]" with her backing vocalist and friend [[Annet Artani]].{{cite web|url=http://www.muumuse.com/2010/02/annet-artani-from-everytime-to-alive.html#more-5249|title=Annet Artani: From "Everytime" to "Alive"|date=2010-02|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Stern|first=Bradley|work=MuuMuse.com|publisher=Bradley Stern}} The same year, [[Limp Bizkit]] frontman [[Fred Durst]] said that he was in a relationship with Spears. However, Spears denied Durst's claims. In a 2009 interview, he explained that "I just guess at the time it was taboo for a guy like me to be associated with a gal like her."{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1607309/20090319/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Fred Durst Looks Back At His Relationship With Britney Spears|date=2009-03-19|accessdate=2010-06-06|last=Jacks|first=Brian|publisher=MTV}} Spears opened the [[2003 MTV Video Music Awards]] with [[Christina Aguilera]], performing "[[Like a Virgin (song)|Like a Virgin]]". Halfway through they were joined by Madonna, with whom they both kissed. The incident was highly publicized. Spears released her fourth studio album, ''[[In the Zone]]'', in November 2003. She assumed more creative control by writing and co-producing most of the material. ''[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]'' called it "A supremely confident dance record that also illustrates Spears's development as a songwriter."{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/artists/spearsbritney/inthezone|title=In The Zone reviews at Metacritic.com:|year=2003|accessdate=2010-06-06|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]}} [[NPR]] listed the album as one of "The 50 Most Important Recording of the Decade", adding that "the decade's history of impeccably crafted pop is written on her body of work."{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=120400577|title=The 50 Most Important Recordings: S-Z : NPR|date=2009-11-16|accessdate=2010-06-06|work=NPR.com|publisher=[[National Public Radio]]}} ''In the Zone'' sold over 609,000 copies in the United States and debuted at the top of the charts, making Spears the first female artist in the SoundScan era to have her first four studio albums to debut at number one. It also debuted at the top of the charts in France and the top ten in Belgium, Denmark, Sweden and the Netherlands.{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=In+The+Zone&cat=a|title=ultratop.be — Britney Spears — In the Zone|work=Ultratop|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=2010-06-06}} ''In the Zone'' sold over 10 million copies worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.store.livenation.com/Product.aspx?cp=13281_16771_16305&pc=MUDD417 |title= ''In the Zone'' sold over 10 million copies worldwide|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-12|publisher=[[Live Nation]]}} The album produced the hit singles: "[[Me Against the Music]]", a collaboration with Madonna; "[[Toxic (song)|Toxic]]"—which won Spears her only Grammy for [[Best Dance Recording]]; "[[Everytime]]" and "[[Outrageous (song)|Outrageous]]". ===2004–07: Motherhood, personal struggles, and ''Blackout''=== [[File:Shadow Live 2004.jpg|thumb|left|Spears performing live on The Onyx Tour in 2004]] On January 3, 2004, Spears married childhood friend Jason Allen Alexander at [[The Little White Wedding Chapel]] in [[Las Vegas]]. The marriage was [[annulment|annulled]] 55 hours later, stating that Spears "lacked understanding of her actions".{{cite news|url=http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/3869708/|title=Judge dissolves Britney's 'joke' wedding |date=2004-04-06|accessdate=2010-06-10|agency=Associated Press|publisher=MSNBC|publisher=[[NBC Universal]] / [[Microsoft]]}} She began [[The Onyx Hotel Tour]] in support of ''In the Zone'' in March 2004.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1485503/20040302/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Checking Into Onyx Hotel Wearing Rubberlike Outfit|date=2004-03-02|accessdate=2009-12-24|last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|publisher=MTV}} On June 8, 2004, Spears fell and injured her left knee during the music video shoot for "[[Outrageous (song)|Outrageous]]". She was taken immediately to a local hospital, where doctors performed an MRI scan and found floating cartilage. The following day, Spears underwent [[arthroscopic surgery]]. She was forced to remain six weeks with a thigh brace, followed by eight to twelve weeks of rehabilitation, which caused The Onyx Hotel Tour to be canceled.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,652994,00.html|title=Britney Cancels Tour Due to Bad Knee|date=2004-06-16|accessdate=2009-12-27|last=Silverman|first=Stephen M.|first2=|last2=|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Time Warner]]}} During 2004, Spears became involved in the [[Kabbalah Centre]] through her friendship with Madonna.{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/12920032/|title=Forget Kabbalah, Britney's baby is her religion — Entertainment — msnbc.com|date=2004-06-01|accessdate=2010-06-10|last=Walls|first=Jeannette|publisher=NBC Universal / Microsoft}} In July 2004, Spears became engaged to American dancer [[Kevin Federline]], whom she had met three months before. The romance received intense attention from the media, since Federline had recently broken up with actress [[Shar Jackson]], who was still pregnant with their second child at the time. The initial stages of their relationship were chronicled in Spears's first reality show ''[[Britney & Kevin: Chaotic]]''. They held a wedding ceremony on September 18, 2004, but were not legally married until three weeks later on October 6 due to a delay finalizing the couple's prenuptial agreement.{{harvnb|Heller|2007|p=80}}{{citation not found}} Shortly after, she released her first fragrance with [[Elizabeth Arden]], ''[[Curious (fragrance)|Curious]]'', which broke the company's first-week gross for a perfume. In October 2004, Spears took another career break to start a family.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1492692/20041016/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Spears Announces She's Taking A Break From Her Career|date=2004-10-16|accessdate=2010-06-10|last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|publisher=MTV}} ''[[Greatest Hits: My Prerogative]]'', her first greatest hits [[compilation album]], was released in November 2004.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1490190/20040813/spears_britney.jhtml?headlines=true|title=Britney Covers Bobby Brown's 'My Prerogative' For Forthcoming LP|date=2004-08-13|accessdate=2010-10-06| last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|publisher=MTV}} Spears's [[cover version]] of [[Bobby Brown]]'s "[[My Prerogative]]" was released as the lead single from the album, reaching the top of the charts in Finland, Ireland, Italy and Norway.{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/fr/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=My+Prerogative&cat=s|title=Britney Spears — My Prerogative (song) |year=2004|work=Ultratop|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=2010-10-06}} The second single, "[[Do Somethin']]", was a top ten hit in Australia, the United Kingdom and other countries of mainland Europe.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/uk_singles_top_75/2005/10|title=UK Singles Chart|date=2005-03-07|accessdate=2010-10-06|publisher=[[The Official Charts Company]]. aCharts}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=Do+Somethin%27&cat=s|title=Britney Spears – Do Somethin' (song)|year=2005|accessdate=2010-10-06|publisher=UltratopHung Medien}} Worldwide, ''Greatest Hits: My Prerogative'' sold over 5 million copies.{{cite web|url=http://www.britney.com/mx/career-highlights|title=Biography – Sales|year=2010|accessdate=2010-06-05|publisher=Britney.com. Sony Music Entertainment|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20101224220054/http://www.britney.com/mx/career-highlights|archivedate=2010-12-24}} In late 2004, Spears went on [[KIIS-FM]] radio in Los Angeles, CA to play a new demo titled "Mona Lisa." The demo was to be the first single from an upcoming album called the "Original Doll." However, Spears's label later cancelled the album for unknown reasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/bands/a/alter_egos_news_feature_050321/|title=Don't Call Me Britney ... Or Mariah, Or Eminem...|year=2004|accessdate=2010-09-28|publisher=MTV}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1495275/20050103/spears_britney.jhtml|title=So Much For 'Taking Time Off' Britney Previews New Song On L.A. Radio Station|date=2005-01-03 |accessdate=2010-10-01|publisher=MTV}} Spears gave birth to her first child, Sean Preston Federline, on September 14, 2005.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1039012_1107631,00.html|title=Britney Welcomes Home Sean Preston|date=2005-09-21|accessdate=2010-10-06| work=People}} In November 2005, she released her first remix compilation, ''[[B in the Mix: The Remixes]]'', which consists of eleven remixes.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1512630/20051031/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Surprise: Britney's Releasing An Album In Just Two Weeks|last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|publisher=MTV|accessdate=2005-11-08|date=2010-10-06}} It has sold over 1 million copies worldwide, making it one of the [[List of best-selling remix albums worldwide|best selling remix albums of all time]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dentonrc.com/sharedcontent/dws/ent/stories/DN-britneyalbums_1103gl.ART.State.Edition1.4209e2e.html|title=Britney Spears' recordings find art imitating life|last=Daniel|first=Mike|date=2007-11-06|accessdate=2011-09-10|work=[[Denton Record-Chronicle]]|publisher=[[A. H. Belo Corporation]]|archiveurl=http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:VaVPZ3evtAsJ:www.dentonrc.com/sharedcontent/dws/ent/stories/DN-britneyalbums_1103gl.ART.State.Edition1.4209e2e.html+%22Britney+Spears%27+recordings+find+art+imitating+life%22&cd=1&hl=pt-BR&ct=clnk&gl=br&|archivedate=2012-01-13}}{{dead link|date=September 2012}} In February 2006, pictures surfaced of Spears driving with her son Sean, on her lap instead of in a car seat. Child advocates were horrified by the photos of her holding the wheel with one hand and Sean with the other. Spears claimed that the situation happened because of a frightening encounter with paparazzi, and that it was a mistake on her part. The following month, she [[Guest appearance|guest-starred]] on the ''[[Will & Grace]]'' episode "[[Buy, Buy Baby]]" as closeted lesbian Amber Louise.{{cite news|url=http://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2006-03-29-britney-sidebar_x.htm|title=USATODAY.com — Britney maybe one more time|last=Thomas|first=Karen|work=USA Today|accessdate=2006-03-29|date=2010-10-06}} She announced she no longer studied Kabbalah in June 2006, explaining, "my baby is my religion." Two months later, Spears posed nude for the cover of ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]''. The picture was heavily compared to [[Demi Moore]]'s [[More Demi Moore|August 1991 ''Vanity Fair'' cover]]. She gave birth to her second child, Jayden James Federline, on September 12, 2006.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,26334,1550177,00.html|title=Britney's Baby Name: Jayden James Federline — Britney Spears |date=2006-10-24|accessdate=2010-10-06| work=People}} On November 7, 2006, Spears filed for divorce from Federline, citing [[irreconcilable differences]].{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1556096,00.html|title=Britney Spears Files for Divorce — Divorced, Britney Spears, Kevin Federline |date=2006-11-07|accessdate=2010-10-06| work=People}} Their divorce was finalized in July 2007, when the couple reached a global settlement and agreed to share joint custody of their children.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b55767_Britney_Kevin_Back_to_Being_Single_.html|title=Britney, Kevin Back to Being Single — E! Online|date=2007-07-30|accessdate=2010-10-06|last=Hall|first=Sarah| work=E! Online|publisher=[[E!]]}} Spears's aunt Sandra Bridges Covington, with whom she had been very close, died of [[ovarian cancer]] in January.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20169661,00.html|title=Lynne Spears Visits Sister's Grave Amid Crisis — Britney Spears, Lynne Spears|date=2008-01-05|accessdate=2010-10-06| work=People}} On February 16, 2007, Spears stayed in a [[drug rehabilitation]] facility in [[Antigua]] for less than a day. The following night, she shaved her head with electric clippers at a hair salon in [[Tarzana, Los Angeles]]. She admitted herself to other treatment facilities during the following weeks.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/Health/story?id=2885048&page=1|title=Bald and Broken: Inside Britney's Shaved Head |date=2007-02-19|accessdate=2010-10-06|last=Marikar|first=Sheila| work=[[ABC News]]|publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company]]}} After completing a month-long program at [[Promises Treatment Centers|Promises]], she wrote on her website, "I truly hit rock bottom. Till this day I don't think that it was alcohol or [[Major depressive disorder|depression]]. [...] was like a bad kid running around with [[ADHD predominantly inattentive|ADD]]." In May 2007, she produced a series of promotional concerts at [[House of Blues]] venues, titled [[The M+M's Tour]].{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1558527/20070502/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney's Back! Spears Returns To The Stage With Five-Song Dirty Dance Party|date=2007-05-02|accessdate=2010-06-10|last=Van Horn|first=Teri|publisher=MTV}} Spears lost physical custody of her children to Federline on October 1, 2007. The reasons of the court ruling were not revealed to the public.{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2007/SHOWBIZ/Music/10/01/spears.federline/index.html|title=Spears will lose custody of children |date=2007-10-02|accessdate=2010-06-11|publisher=CNN}} Also, in 2007 Spears was sued by [[Louis Vuitton]] over her 2005 music video "Do Somethin'" for pimping out her [[Hummer]] interior in counterfeit Louis Vuitton cherry blossom fabric, which resulted in her video being banned on European TV stations.Hollyscope Team, "Louis Vuitton Sues Britney Spears", hollyscoop.com, November 19, 2007 Her fifth studio album, ''[[Blackout (Britney Spears album)|Blackout]]'', was released in October 2007. It debuted at the top of charts in Canada and Ireland, number two in the U.S. ''Billboard'' 200,—held off from the top spot by [[Eagles (band)|Eagles]]'s ''[[Long Road out of Eden]]''— France, Japan, Mexico and the United Kingdom and the top ten in Australia, Korea, New Zealand and many European nations. In the United States, Spears became the only female artist to have her first five studio albums debut at the two top slots of the chart.{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/britney-spears-debuts-1-on-european-albums-chart-and-debuts-1-on-us-digital-albums-chart-58819832.html|title=Britney Spears Debuts No. 1 on European Albums Chart and Debuts No. 1 on... |date=2007-11-08|accessdate=2010-06-11|publisher=[[PR Newswire]]}} ''Blackout'' sold over 3.1 million copies worldwide.{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2008/nov/28/britney-spears-circus|title=CD review: Britney Spears: Circus |date=2008-11-28|accessdate=2010-06-11|last=Petridis|first=Alexis|work=The Guardian |location=UK }} Peter Robinson of ''[[The Observer]]'' said that "Britney has delivered the best album of her career, raising the bar for modern pop music with an incendiary mix of [[Timbaland]]'s ''[[Shock Value (Timbaland album)|Shock Value]]'' and her own back catalogue."{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2007/nov/11/shopping.popandrock1|title=CDs: Britney Spears, Blackout and Kylie Minogue, X |date=2007-11-11|accessdate=2010-06-11|last=Robinson|first=Peter|work=The Observer |location=UK }} Dennis Lim of ''[[Blender (magazine)|Blender]]'' commented, "Spears's fifth studio album is her most consistent, a seamlessly entertaining collection of bright, brash [[Synthpop|electropop]]."{{cite journal|url=|title=Blackout — Blender|date=2007-10-30|last=Lim|first=Dennis|work=[[Blender (magazine)|Blender]]|publisher=Alpha Media Group|issn=1534-0554|ref=harv}} ''Blackout'' won Album of the Year at [[MTV Europe Music Awards 2008]] and was listed as the fifth Best Pop Album of the Decade by ''[[The Times]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/showbiz/2008/11/07/britney-spears-seals-comeback-with-two-gongs-at-mtv-europe-music-awards-86908-20875355/|title=Britney Spears seals comeback with two gongs at MTV Europe Music Awards |date=2008-11-07|accessdate=2010-06-11|last=Lyons|first=Bev|last2=Sutherland|first2=Laura|work=The Daily Record |location=Scotland}}{{cite news|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article6922991.ece|title=The 100 best pop albums of the Noughties |date=2009-11-21|accessdate=2010-06-11|work=The Times |location=UK|first1=Anushka|last1=Asthana}} Spears performed the lead single "[[Gimme More]]" at the [[2007 MTV Video Music Awards]]. The performance was panned by many critics. David Willis of [[BBC]] stated her performance would "go down in the history books as being one of the worst to grace the MTV Awards".{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6986539.stm|title= Britney's MTV comeback falls flat|date=2007-09-10|accessdate=2010-02-24|last=Willis|first=David|publisher=BBC }} Despite the backlash, the single rocketed to worldwide success, peaking at number one in Canada and the top ten in almost every country it charted.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/canada_singles_top_100/2007/41|title=Canada Singles Top 100|date=2007-10-13|accessdate=2010-02-23|work=Billboard|publisher=acharts.us}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/fr/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=Gimme+More&cat=s|title=Britney Spears – Gimme More (song)|year=2007|accessdate=2010-02-23|work=Ultratop|publisher=Hung Medien}} The second single "[[Piece of Me]]" reached the top of the charts in Ireland and reached the top five in Australia, Canada, Denmark, New Zealand and the United Kingdom. The third single "[[Break the Ice (Britney Spears song)|Break the Ice]]" was released the following year and had moderate success due to Spears not being able to promote it properly.{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/australia_singles_top_50/2008/06|title=Australian Singles Chart|date=2008-03-01| accessdate=2010-02-06|publisher=acharts.us}}{{cite web|url=http://acharts.us/uk_singles_top_75/2007/52|title=UK Singles Chart|date=2007-12-23| accessdate=2010-02-10|work=[[The Official Charts Company]]|publisher=acharts.us}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/fr/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=Piece+of+Me&cat=s|title=Britney Spears – Piece of Me(song)|year=2008|accessdate=2010-02-10|work=Ultratop 50|publisher=Hung Medien}} In December 2007, Spears began a relationship with [[paparazzo]] Adnan Ghalib.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20168997,00.html|title=Britney Pap-Happy with Her New Guy — Britney Spears|date=2008-01-03|accessdate=2010-02-12|work=People}} ===2008–10: Conservatorship and ''Circus''=== [[File:Brtiney SpearsMontreal3.jpg|right|thumb|Spears performing "Freakshow" at [[The Circus Starring Britney Spears]], 2009.|alt=Image of a blond female performer. She has a headset around her hand and is wearing sparkly silver and black lingerie, fishnet stockings and knee-high black boots. She stands in front of a black and golden couch.]] On January 3, 2008, Spears refused to relinquish custody of her sons to Federline's representatives. She was hospitalized at [[Cedars-Sinai Medical Center]], after police that arrived at her house noted she appeared to be under the influence of an illicit substance. The following day, Spears's visitation rights were suspended at an emergency court hearing, and Federline was given sole physical and legal custody of the children. On January 31, 2008, Spears was committed to the psychiatric ward of [[Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center]] and put on [[5150 (Involuntary psychiatric hold)|5150 involuntary psychiatric hold]]. The court placed her under temporary [[conservatorship]] of her father James Spears and attorney Andrew Wallet, giving them complete control of her assets. Spears was released on February 6, 2008. Her parents expressed disappointment and concern at the decision to release her.{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2008/feb/07/local/me-britney7|title=Spears is released from UCLA hospital psychiatric ward — Los Angeles Times|date=2008-02-07|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Blankstein|first=Andrew|last2=Winton|first2=Richard|work=Los Angeles Times|publisher=[[Tribune Company]]}} The following month, she guest-starred on the ''[[How I Met Your Mother]]'' episode "[[Ten Sessions]]" as receptionist Abby. She received positive reviews for her performance, as well as bringing the series its highest ratings ever.{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/2008/03/24/2008-03-24_britney_spears_begins_rehab_of_image_wit-1.html?ref=rss|title=Britney Spears begins rehab of image with wacky cameo on CBS sitcom|date=2008-03-25|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Hinckley|first=D.|work=Daily News |location=New York }}{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/television/news/e3ia2cce804ce40901d82b7a82b3af831e3?imw=Y|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080606035305/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/television/news/e3ia2cce804ce40901d82b7a82b3af831e3?imw=Y|archivedate=2008-06-06|title=Spears delivers 'Mother's' highest ratings|date=2008-03-25|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Hibberd|first=James|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=e5 Global Media}} In July 2008, Spears regained some visitation rights after coming to an agreement with Federline and his counsel.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20213350,00.html|title=It's Over: Britney & Kevin Reach a Custody Settlement — Scandals & Feuds, Britney Spears, Kevin Federline|date=2008-07-18|accessdate=2010-02-12|last=Lee|first=Ken|work=People}} On September 7, 2008, Spears opened the [[2008 MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Awards]] with a pre-taped comedy sketch with [[Jonah Hill]] and an introduction speech. She won [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Female Video|Best Female Video]], [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Pop Video|Best Pop Video]] and [[MTV Video Music Award for Video of the Year|Video of the Year]] for "Piece of Me".{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/ontv/vma/2008/|title=Highlights, Winners, Performers and Photos from the 2008 MTV Video Music Awards|year=2008|accessdate=2010-06-12|publisher=MTV}} A 60-minute introspective documentary, ''[[Britney: For the Record]]'', was produced to chronicle Spears's return to the recording industry. Directed by Phil Griffin, ''For the Record'' was entirely shot in [[Beverly Hills]], Hollywood, and New York City during the third quarter of 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1596736/20081009/spears_britney.jhtml|title=Britney Spears 'Sets The Record Straight' In Documentary Airing November 30 On MTV|last=Vena|first=Jocelyn|date=2008-10-09|publisher=MTV|accessdate=2011-01-01}} Main shooting began on September 5, 2008, two days before Spears's appearance at the [[2008 MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Awards]]. ''For the Record'' was broadcast on MTV on November 30, 2008 to 5.6 million viewers for the two airings on the premiere night. MTV reported that Spears's documentary garnered on average, the highest rating in its Sunday night timeslot, in the network's history.{{cite web|url=http://mtvpress.com/music/release/britney_for_the_record_scores_staggering_3_54_p12_34_rating/|title="Britney: For the Record" scores staggering 3.54 P12–34 rating in Sunday debut on MTVh|date=2008-12-02|publisher=MTV|accessdate=2011-01-02}} Her sixth studio album ''[[Circus (Britney Spears album)|Circus]]'', was released in December 2008. It received positive reviews from critics; according to the music review aggregation of [[Metacritic]], it garnered an average score of 64/100.{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/artists/spearsbritney/circus | title=Circus reviews at Metacritic.com | publisher=[[Metacritic]] | accessdate=2010-06-12}} ''Circus'' debuted at number one in Canada, Czech Republic and the United States, and inside the top in many European nations.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/britney-s-circus-debuts-atop-album-chart-1003921424.story|title=Britney's 'Circus' Debuts Atop Album Chart|date=2008-12-10|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Hasty|first=Katie|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media}} In the United States, Spears became the youngest female artist to have five albums debut at number one, earning a place in the ''[[Guinness Book of World Records]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.britney.com/us/blog/britney-earns-another-guinness-world-record|title=Britney Earns (Another) Guinness World Record|date=2009-09-27|accessdate=2010-06-12|work=Britney.com|publisher=Jive}} She also became the only act in the Soundscan era to have four albums debut with 500,000 or more copies sold. ''Circus'' became one of the fastest-selling albums of the year,{{cite news|url=http://www.forbes.com/lists/2009/53/celebrity-09_Britney-Spears_PREW.html|title=#13 Britney Spears — The 2009 Celebrity 100 |date=2009-03-06|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Reporter|first=Staff|work=Forbes}} and has sold 4 million copies worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.hmv.co.jp/news/article/909250129/ |title=Britney Spears' Singles Collection |publisher=HMV Store Japan |date=2010-06-01 |accessdate=2010-06-01}}{{cite web|url=http://babelfish.yahoo.com/translate_url?doit=done&tt=url&intl=1&fr=bf-home&trurl=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.hmv.co.jp%2Fnews%2Farticle%2F909250129%2F&lp=ja_en&btnTrUrl=Translate |title=Britney Spears' Singles Collection |publisher=HMV Store Japan (Yahoo! Translation) |date=2010-01-12 |accessdate=2010-01-12}} Its lead single, "[[Womanizer (song)|Womanizer]]", became her first number one in the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 since "...Baby One More Time" and topped the charts in countries such as Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Norway and Sweden.{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003874105#/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003874105|title=Spears Scores Record-Setting Hot 100 Jump|date=2008-10-15|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Reporter|first=Billboard|work=Billboard|publisher=Nielsen Company}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/en/showitem.asp?interpret=Britney+Spears&titel=Womanizer&cat=s|title=Britney Spears — Womanizer (song)|year=2008|accessdate=2010-06-12|work=Ultratop|publisher=Hung Medien}} It was also nominated for a Grammy in the category of Best Dance Recording.{{cite news|url=http://www2.grammy.com/grammy_awards/52nd_show/list.aspx|title=Nominees list for the 52nd Grammy Awards|date=2009-12-02|work=Los Angeles Times |accessdate=2009-12-03}} In January 2009, Spears and her father James obtained a restraining order against her former manager Sam Lufti, ex-boyfriend Adnan Ghalib and attorney Jon Eardley—all of whom, court documents claim, had been conspiring to gain control of Spears's affairs. The restraining order forbids Lutfi and Ghalib from contacting Spears or coming within 250 yards of her, her property or family members.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Britney-Restraining-Order-1002335.aspx|title=Britney Gets Restraining Order Against Former Manager, Ex-Beau and Attorney|date=2009-01-31|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Mitovich|first=Matt|work=[[TV Guide]]|publisher=OpenGate Capital}} Spears embarked on [[The Circus Starring Britney Spears]] in March 2009. With a gross of U.S. $131.8 million, it became the fifth highest grossing tour of the year.{{cite web|url=http://www.pollstarpro.com/SpecialFeatures2009/2009YearEndTop50WorldwideConcertTours.pdf|title= 2009 Year End Top 50 Worldwide Concert Tours|year=2010|accessdate=2010-02-08|publisher=[[Pollstar]]}} She released her second greatest hits album, ''[[The Singles Collection (Britney Spears album)|The Singles Collection]]'' in November 2009. "[[3 (song)|3]]" became her third number one single in the US, and was the first song to debut at the top of the charts in three years.{{cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/news/3-to-1-britney-beats-odds-to-debut-atop-1004021929.story|title='3' To 1: Britney Beats Odds To Debut Atop Hot 100|date=2009-10-14|accessdate=2010-01-04|last=Pietroluongo|first=Silvio|work=Billboard|publisher=Nielsen Company}} Later that month, she released an application for [[iPhone]] and [[iPod Touch]] titled "It's Britney!".{{cite web|url=http://www.britneyspears.com/2009/11/its-britney-app-for-iphone-and-ipod-touch-goes-live.php|title="IT'S BRITNEY!" APP FOR iPHONE and iPOD TOUCH GOES LIVE — BRITNEY SPEARS|date=2009-11-16|accessdate=2010-07-03|last=Staff|first=Lauren|publisher=BritneySpears.com. Brandcasting Unlimited|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20091119174144/http://www.britneyspears.com/2009/11/its-britney-app-for-iphone-and-ipod-touch-goes-live.php|archivedate=2009-11-19}} In May 2010, Spears's representatives confirmed she was dating her agent Jason Trawick, and that they had decided to end their professional relationship to focus on their personal relationship.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20368457,00.html|title=Britney Spears and Jason Trawick Split – Professionally — Britney Spears |date=2010-05-11|accessdate=2010-06-12|last=Jordan|first=Julie|work=People}} Spears designed a limited edition clothing line for [[Candie's]], which was released in stores in July 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1642722/britney-spears-design-clothing-candies.jhtml|title=Britney Spears To Design Clothing For Candie's|last=Vena|first=Jocelyn|date=2010-06-30|accessdate=2012-04-05|publisher=MTV. MTV Networks}} On September 28, 2010, she made a cameo appearance on a Spears-themed tribute episode of American TV show ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'', titled "[[Britney/Brittany]]". Spears approved of the episode, although her appearances received mixed reviews from critics.{{cite web|url=http://hollywoodcrush.mtv.com/2010/09/29/britney-spears-and-hayley-williams-react-to-last-nights-glee-in-todays-tweet-dreams/|title=Britney Spears And Hayley Williams React To Last Night's 'Glee' In Today's Tweet Dreams|last=Semigran|first=Aly|date=2010-09-29|publisher=MTV|accessdate=2010-10-04}}{{cite web|url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/britneybrittany,45620/|title=Britney/Brittany|last=VanDerWerff|first=Todd|date=2010-09-29|work=[[The A.V. Club]]|accessdate=2010-09-29}} The episode drew ''Glee'''s second largest audience, as well as the show's highest ratings ever.{{cite web|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/09/glee-ratings-britney-is-bigger-than-madonna.html|title='Glee' ratings: Britney is bigger than Madonna|first=Rick|last=Porter|work=[[Zap2it]]|publisher=[[Tribune Media Services]]|date=2010-09-29|accessdate=2010-09-29}}{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/09/29/tuesday-finals-glee-no-ordinary-family-ncis-dancing-up-raising-hope-detroit-1-8-7-running-wilde-down/65835|title=Tuesday Finals: Glee, No Ordinary Family, NCIS, Dancing Up; Raising Hope, Detroit 1–8–7, Running Wilde Down|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=2010-09-29|work=TV by the Numbers|accessdate=2010-09-29}} ===2011: ''Femme Fatale''=== [[File:Britney GM Detroit FFT.jpg|left|thumb|Spears performing "Gimme More" at the [[Femme Fatale Tour]], 2011.|alt=Image of a blond female performer surrounded by a group of dancers. She is sitting on a purple coach and wearing a golden outfit. The dancers are wearing short black hooded sweatshirts.]] In March 2011, Spears released her seventh studio album [[Femme Fatale (Britney Spears album)|''Femme Fatale'']].{{cite web|url=http://www.jiverecords.com/news/7th-britney-spears-album-femme-fatale-set-for-march-29th-release|title=7th Britney Spears Album "Femme Fatale" Set for March 29th Release|publisher=Jive Records|date=2011-08-02|accessdate=2011-03-06}} [[Max Martin]] and [[Dr. Luke]] executive produced the album and the album's first single "[[Hold It Against Me]]". The single debuted at number-one on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. This gave Spears her fourth number-one single on the chart, and made her only the second artist in history to have two consecutive singles debut at number-one, after [[Mariah Carey]].http://www.billboard.com/#/news/britney-spears-hold-it-against-me-single-1004138395.story The album peaked at number one in the United States (selling 276,000 copies in its first week), Canada, and Australia, and peaked inside the top ten on nearly every other chart. The album's peak in the United States ties Britney with Mariah Carey and Janet Jackson for the third-most number ones among women.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/britney-spears-snares-sixth-no-1-on-billboard-1005113312.story#/news/britney-spears-snares-sixth-no-1-on-billboard-1005113312.story |title=Britney Spears Snares Sixth No. 1 on Billboard 200 with 'Femme Fatale' |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |date=2009-09-14 |accessdate=2011-04-24}} As of March 9, 2012, ''Femme Fatale'' has sold 883,000 copies in the United States and 2.2 million worldwide and has been certified platinum by the [[RIAA]].{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/adele-katy-perry-rule-mid-year-soundscan-1005266992.story#/news/adele-katy-perry-rule-mid-year-billboard-1005266992.story?page=2|title=Adele, Katy Perry Rule Mid-Year SoundScan Charts|work=Billboard|date=2011-06-06 |accessdate=2011-06-09}}{{cite certification|region=United States|artist=Britney Spears|type=album}} The album received positive critical reviews after its release, receiving a score of 67 on [[Metacritic]], her highest critical score since ''Oops!... I Did It Again,'' with many critics naming the album one of Spears's best.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/femme-fatale|title=Britney Spears – Femme Fatale – Metacritic|publisher=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=2011-03-25}} In April 2011, Spears appeared in a remix to the song [[S&M (song)|"S&M"]] by [[Rihanna]] after Rihanna asked her fans via Twitter who they wanted her to collaborate with.{{cite web|last=Vena |first=Jocelyn |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1661717/britney-spears-rihanna.jhtml |title=Rihanna Says Britney Spears' 'S&M' Remix 'Had To Be Major' |publisher=MTV |date=2011-04-11 |accessdate=2011-04-24}} The song reached number one in the US in mid-April 2011, giving Spears her fifth number one on the chart.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/news/rihanna-s-s-m-reigns-on-hot-100-lady-gaga-1005144922.story|title=Rihanna's 'S&M' Reigns on Hot 100, Lady Gaga's 'Judas' Debuts|last=Trust|first=Gary|date=2011-04-20|accessdate=2011-09-26|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media}} In early May, Spears's second single from ''Femme Fatale'', "[[Till The World Ends]]", reached number three on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 and had ninety-eight million audience impressions on the ''Billboard'' chart, granting Spears the highest weekly audience of her 13-year chart career.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/listen-britney-spears-nicki-minaj-and-ke-1005151752.story#/news/adele-s-rolling-in-the-deep-tops-hot-100-1005179322.story |title=Listen: Britney Spears, Nicki Minaj and Ke$ha's 'Till the World Ends' Remix.|work=Billboard |date=2009-09-14 |accessdate=2011-08-20}} The song was also named by critics as one of the best songs of 2011.{{cite web|url=http://popcrush.com/pop-songs-2011/|title=TOP 10 POP SONGS OF 2011|last=Lanksy|first=Sam|accessdate=2011-12-19|publisher=PopCrush}}{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/features/critics-picks-20-best-songs-of-2011-1005671592.story?page=2|title=Critics' Picks: 20 Best Songs of 2011|work=Billboard|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|date=2011-12-13|accessdate=2011-12-19}}{{cite web|url=http://idolator.com/6115721/nicki-minajs-super-bass-named-1-song-of-2011-by-ew-billboard|title=Nicki Minaj’s "Super Bass" Named No. 1 Song Of 2011 By ‘EW’ & ‘Billboard’ |work=Idolator|date=2011-12-19|accessdate=2011-12-19}} ''Femme Fatale's'' third single "[[I Wanna Go]]" reached the top forty on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 in June 2011. Among females in the last thirteen years, Spears now has the third-most top forty hits, with twenty-one.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/record-labels/britney-spears-snares-21st-top-40-hot-100-1005260482.story|title=Britney Spears Snares 21st Top 40 Hot 100 Single; Florence & the Machine Bounces Up Billboard 200: Chart Moves|publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)]]|last=Trust|first=Gary|date=2011-06-30|accessdate=2011-06-30}} In August, the single managed to reach the top-ten on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, which is the first time for Spears to have three songs from one album in the top-ten.http://www.billboard.com/#/artist/britney-spears/290150 On the week ending September 24, 2011, "I Wanna Go" moved 2–1 on the [[Mainstream Top 40 (Pop Songs)|mainstream top 40]], becoming her sixth number-one on that chart (making her tied for third all-time) and her first number-one and third top-ten pop song for ''Femme Fatale.''{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/column/chartbeat/britney-spears-sustained-success-go-es-on-1005349002.story#/column/chartbeat/britney-spears-sustained-success-go-es-on-1005349002.story|title=Britney Spears' Sustained Success 'Go'-es On At Pop Radio|publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)]]|last=Trust|first=Gary|date=2011-09-12|accessdate=2011-09-12}} Spears now has the longest span of number ones on the mainstream top 40, with a length of twelve years, seven months, and four days. In October 2011, the music video for ''Femme Fatale''{{'s}} fourth single "[[Criminal (Britney Spears song)|Criminal]]" caused controversy when British politicians criticized Spears for using replica guns while filming the video in an area of London that had been badly affected by the [[2011 England riots]]. Members of the [[Hackney London Borough Council]] felt Spears "promoted gun violence" and suggested that Spears apologize and make a donation to a Hackney charity.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a341976/britney-spears-angers-mps-over-criminal-video-shoot.html|title=Britney Spears angers MPs over 'Criminal' video shoot|last=Copsey|first=Robert|publisher=Digital Spy. Hachette Filipacchi (UK) Ltd|date=2011-10-31|accessdate=2011-09-23}} Spears's management briefly responded, stating, "The video is a fantasy story featuring Britney's boyfriend, Jason Trawick, which literally plays out the lyrics of a song written three years before the riots ever happened."{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1671542/britney-spears-criminal-video-gun-criticism-response.jhtml|title=Britney Spears Responds To 'Criminal' Video Controversy|last=Montgomery|first=James|date=2011-09-26|accessdate=2011-10-31|publisher=MTV. MTV Networks}} On ''Billboard''{{'}}s 2011 Year-End list, Spears was fourteen on the Artists of the Year,{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/charts-year-end/top-artists?year=2011&begin=11&order=position|title=Best of 2011: The Artists|accessdate=2011-12-19|work=Billboard}} due to being 32 on ''Billboard'' 200 artists and 10 on ''Billboard'' Hot 100 artists.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/charts-year-end/the-billboard-200-artists?year=2011&begin=21&order=position|title=Best of 2011: Billboard 200 Artists|accessdate=2011-12-19|work=Billboard}}{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/charts-year-end/hot-100-artists?year=2011|title=Best of 2011: Hot 100 Artists|accessdate=2011-12-19|work=Billboard}} [[File:Britney Spears X-Factor 2012.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Spears at auditions for ''[[The X Factor (U.S.)|The X Factor]]'', June 2012.]] On 16 June 2011, Spears opened the [[Femme Fatale Tour]] at the [[Power Balance Pavilion]] in [[Sacramento]], California.{{cite press release|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/pop-superstar-britney-spears-announces-special-guest-nicki-minaj-to-join-the-highly-anticipated-all-female-femme-fatale-tour-119685009.html|title=Pop Superstar Britney Spears Announces Special Guest Nicki Minaj to Join the Highly Anticipated All Female Femme Fatale Tour|publisher=[[PR Newswire]]|author=[[Live Nation]]|date=2011-04-12|accessdate=2011-04-12}} The tour received positive reviews.{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/moviestvmusic/news/britney-spears-earns-raves-for-femme-fatale-tour-opener-2011176|title=Britney Spears Earns Raves for Femme Fatale Tour Opener|publisher=[[Wenner Media]]|author=[[Us Weekly]]|date=2011-04-12|accessdate=2011-07-27}} Many critics noted that Spears sang more of the concert live in response to lip-synching accusations during The Circus Starring Britney Spears, and that the dancing is some of her best in years. The first ten US dates of the tour grossed $6.2 million, landing the fifty-fifth spot on Pollstar's Top 100 North American Tours list for the half-way point of the year.{{cite web|url=http://www.pollstarpro.com/files/Charts2011/07181Ttop100NorthAmericanTours.pdf|title=Top 100 North American Tours|publisher=Pollstar|date=2011-06-30|accessdate=2011-07-09}} The tour ended on December 10, 2011 in Puerto Rico after 79 performances.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1675774/britney-spears-tour-wrap.jhtml|title=Britney Spears Wraps Femme Fatale Tour|publisher=MTVdate=2011-12-12|accessdate=2011-12-19}} The DVD of the tour was eventually released on 21 November 2011{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/Britney-Spears-Live-Femme-Fatale/dp/B005TQAI6G/ref=sr_1_2?s=movies-tv&ie=UTF8&qid=1319587212&sr=1-2|title=Britney Spears Live: The Femme Fatale Tour (2011)|publisher=Amazon.com|date=2011-10-25|accessdate=2011-10-25}}{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/Britney-Spears-Live-Fatale-Blu-ray/dp/B005TQACLC/ref=sr_1_2?s=movies-tv&ie=UTF8&qid=1319494988&sr=1-2|title=Britney Spears Live: The Femme Fatale Tour [Blu-ray] (2011)|publisher=Amazon.com|date=2011-12-19|accessdate=2011-12-19}} and it sold 19,000 copies, debuting at no. 2 on the US ''Billboard'' DVD Chart.{{cite web|url=http://music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart-watch/week-ending-nov-27-2011-albums-buble-wins-171641841.html|title=Week Ending Nov. 27, 2011. Albums: Buble Wins A Squeaker |publisher=[[Yahoo! Music]]. [[Yahoo!]] |date=2011-11-30 |first=Paul |last=Grein |accessdate=2011-11-30}} Since its release, the DVD has been certified Platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA),{{cite web|url=http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?content_selector=gold-platinum-searchable-database&artist=britney%20spears|title=RIAA – SEARCHABLE DATABASE – Britney Spearsaccessdate=2011-12-12|publisher=RIAA}} and Gold by the [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] (ARIA).{{cite web|url=http://www.ariacharts.com.au/pages/charts_display_music.asp?chart=1V40DVD|title=ARIA Top 40 Music DVD Chart|date=2011-12-12|accessdate=2011-12-12|publisher=Australian Recording Industry Association|archivedate=2011-12-12|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/63qvdvTxy}} In August 2011, Britney had officially joined the [[RCA Records]]'s roster due to [[Jive Records]] being fully move under RCA Records.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/record-labels/l-a-reid-to-run-restructured-epic-records-1005237912.story|title=L.A. Reid to Run Restructured Epic Records|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|date=2011-06-15|accessdate=2011-09-26|last=Halperin|first=Shirley}}{{cite web|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/95527/rca-records-announces-new-leadership-structure|title=RCA Records Announces New Leadership Structure|date=2011-08-23|accessdate=2011-09-26|publisher=All Access}} But in 7 October 2011, [[RCA Music Group]] announced it was disbanding [[Jive Records]]. With the shutdown, Spears will release her future material on [[RCA Records]].{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/record-labels/rca-s-new-executive-team-named-under-ceo-1005324782.story|title=RCA's New Executive Team Named Under CEO Peter Edge Amid Layoffs|date=2011-08-23|accessdate=2011-10-19|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|last=Christman|first=Ed}}{{cite web|url=http://www.fmqb.com/article.asp?id=2268707|title=Unveiling The New Look RCA Records|date=2011-08-23|accessdate=2011-10-19|work=[[FMQB]]}} During the [[2011 MTV Video Music Awards]] on August 28, 2011, MTV played tribute to Spears with a group of young female dancers that memorialised Britney's music videos, performances, and style. Following which, Spears accepted the [[MTV Video Vanguard Award]] from Lady Gaga, who said that "industry wouldn't be the same without [her]".{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/news/britney-spears-tribute-coming-to-vmas-amy-1005316942.story|title=Britney Spears Tribute Coming to VMAs, Amy Winehouse Tribute In the Works|date=2011-08-15|accessdate=2011-09-26|last=Gallo|first=Phil|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1669862/britney-spears-lady-gaga-kiss-vmas.jhtml|title=Britney Spears Accepts Video Vanguard VMA – And A Kiss From Lady Gaga|date=2011-08-28|accessdate=2011-08-28|publisher=MTV. MTV Networks|last=Mitchell|first=John}} On September 7, 2011, Spears released her second remix album, ''[[B in the Mix: The Remixes Vol. 2]]''.{{cite web|url=http://idolator.com/6006322/britney-b-in-the-mix-remixes-vol-2-track-listing|title=Britney Spears Reveals ‘B In The Mix: The Remixes Vol. 2′ Track Listing|date=2011-09-09|accessdate=2011-09-09|last=Bain|first=Becky|publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]. [[Buzz Media]]}} On December 16, Spears confirmed her engagement to her long-time boyfriend Jason Trawick, her former agent.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1676248/britney-spears-engagement-ring.jhtml|title=Britney Spears' Engagement Ring: How Does It Stack Up? |date=2011-12-19|accessdate=2011-12-19|work=MTV News|publisher=MTV|last=Vena|first=Jocelyn}} Spears revealed her three-carat diamond ring at a party in Las Vegas on December 17.{{cite news|url=http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2011/12/19/britney-spears-shows-off-sparkler-in-vegas/|title=Britney Spears shows off sparkler in Vegas|date=2011-12-19|accessdate=2011-12-19|publisher=CNN}} ===2012: ''The X Factor''=== In 2012, Britney Spears became one of the new judges for the ''[[The X Factor (U.S. season 2)|The X Factor]]'' with a salary of $15 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/britney_spears_will_get_15_million_be_x/307137|title=Britney Spears Will Get Record $15 Million Payday to Be X Factor Judge|last=Bromley|first=Melanie|date=2012-04-12 |accessdate=2012-04-12 |publisher=[[E!|E! Online]]}}{{cite web |url=http://www.thexfactorusa.com/articles/the-x-factor-new-judges |title=The X Factor New Judges |work=TheXFactorUSA.com |accessdate=2012-05-14 |date=2012-05-14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1684813/britney-spears-x-factor-judge.jhtml|title=Britney Spears Joins 'X Factor' As A Judge|last=Byrne|first=Katie|date=2012-05-09|accessdate=2012-05-14|publisher=MTV MTV Networks}} While judging the show, Spears turned down Don Philip, who she performed the duet "I Will Still Love You" with on her debut album ''...Baby One More Time''. Spears also recorded a track with [[will.i.am]] and the track is set to be included on will.i.am's upcoming studio album, ''[[Willpower (will.i.am album)|#willpower]]'' (2012).{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/68479/william-Teases-Britney-Spears-Shakira-Alicia-Keys-Collaborations|title=will.i.am Teases Britney Spears, Shakira, Alicia Keys Collaborations|last=Kitchener|first=Shaun|date=2012-01-30|accessdate=2011-09-11|publisher=Entertainment Wise}} ==Artistry== ===Musical style=== Following her debut, Spears was credited with leading the revival of [[teen pop]] in the late 1990s. ''[[The Daily Yomiuri]]'' reported that "[m]usic critics have hailed her as the most gifted teenage pop idol for many years, but Spears has set her sights a little higher-she is aiming for the level of superstardom that has been achieved by Madonna and [[Janet Jackson]]."{{Cite news|title=Teen pop idols stage comeback|newspaper=Yomiuri Shimbun|page=1|date=1999-11-25|postscript=}} Rob Sheffield of ''Rolling Stone'' wrote: "Britney Spears carries on the classic archetype of the rock & roll teen queen, the dungaree doll, the angel baby who just has to make a scene."{{cite web|title=Oops!...I Did It Again – Album Review|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/oops-i-did-it-again-20040609|last=Sheffield|first=Rob|date=2004-06-09|accessdate=2009-10-08|work=Rolling Stone|publisher=Jann Wenner}} Rami Yacoub who co-produced Spears's debut album with lyricist Max Martin, commented, "I know from [[Denniz Pop]] and Max's previous productions, when we do songs, there's kind of a nasal thing. With N' Sync and the Backstreet Boys, we had to push for that mid-nasal voice. When Britney did that, she got this kind of raspy, sexy voice."{{cite book | last = Bronson | first = Fred| title = The Billboard book of number 1 hits | publisher=Billboard Books | year = 2003 | page = 377 | isbn = 978-0-8230-7677-2}} Following the release of her debut album, Chuck Taylor of ''Billboard'' observed, "Spears has become a consummate performer, with snappy dance moves, a clearly real-albeit young-and funkdified voice ... "[[(You Drive Me) Crazy]]", her third single ... demonstrates Spears's own development, proving that the 17-year-old is finding her own vocal personality after so many months of steadfast practice."{{Cite news |last=Taylor | first=Chuck | title=Britney Spears: (You Drive Me) Crazy | newspaper=Billboard |volume=111|issue=35| page=27 | date=1999-08-28 |postscript=}} Stephen Thomas Erlewine of Allmusic referred to her music as a "blend of infectious, rap-inflected dance-pop and smooth balladry."{{cite web|last=Erlewine|first=Stephen|title=...Baby One More Time|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r384763|pure_url=yes}}|year=1999|accessdate=2009-10-08|postscript=}} Spears later commented, "With ''[[...Baby One More Time]]'', I didn't get to show my voice off.
